intro: Perezia pristiphylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaved perezia, is a species of flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, adapting to the harsh environmental conditions of its habitat. It features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer months. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, Perezia pristiphylla is considered a rare and endemic species.
